boat.full_description: Built by Aldous of Brightlingsea as a Whitstable smack. After working for nearly 20 years, she was bought and converted to a yacht in 1931.Stolen from moorings at Portsmouth in 1945, and found 5 weeks later at Fecamp in France as a partial wreck with nearly all her canvas torn.In 1959 she suffered a Calor gas explosion in the canal at Heybridge, the whole cabin top being blown off.Repaired by Dicks and Kerly of Maldon and re-certified A1 by Lloyds. Restored at Woodbridge sometime after 1967.
boat.name: Pembeth
